intro: Margaritopsis nana, commonly known as the dwarf margaritopsis, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and prefers a sunny to partially shaded environment. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
